conclusion: Analyze forces on sliders A and B to find external force F.
Slider A has gravitational force mg, normal force NA, tension T, and frictional force fA.
Slider B has gravitational force mg, normal force NB, tension T', and frictional force fB.
Component of gravitational force on A along incline is 0.6mg.
Component of normal force on A is NA cos 37°.
Frictional force on A is fA = 0.5 NA cos 37°.
Equation of motion for A: T - 0.6mg - 0.5 NA cos 37° = 0.
Solve for T: T = 0.6mg + 0.5 NA cos 37°.
Component of gravitational force on B along incline is 0.6mg.
Component of normal force on B is NB cos 37°.
Frictional force on B is fB = 0.5 NB cos 37°.
Equation of motion for B: F - T' - 0.6mg - 0.5 NB cos 37° = 0.
Since T = T', substitute T in equation for B.
Substitute T in B's equation: F - 1.2mg - 0.5 (NA + NB) cos 37° = 0.
Sliders on verge of sliding, frictional forces at maximum.
NA sin 37° = mg cos 37°, solve for NA: NA = (4/3)mg.
NB sin 37° = mg cos 37° + T sin 37°, substitute T.
